notes: First generation compact crossover SUV based on Lancer platform. Timing belt maintenance required every 60k miles. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mitsubishi Outlander article, January 17, 2025 revision.

Second generation with optional third-row seating. Available with V6 engine and 6-speed automatic. Timing chain on both engines. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mitsubishi Outlander article, January 17, 2025 revision.
Ninth generation compact sedan, redesigned on global platform. Timing chain engine. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mitsubishi Lancer article, January 17, 2025 revision.

Eighth generation compact sedan. Sportback wagon variant available. Timing belt maintenance required. Ralliart performance trim added 2004. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mitsubishi Lancer article, January 17, 2025 revision.

High-performance AWD sport sedan with turbocharged 4G63 engine. Active Center Differential and Active Yaw Control. MR (Mitsubishi Racing) variant with 6-speed and upgraded components. Requires premium fuel and frequent oil changes. Timing belt critical maintenance item. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mitsubishi Lancer Evolution article, January 17, 2025 revision.

Final evolution of 4G63 turbocharged engine. MIVEC variable valve timing. Active Center Differential and Super Active Yaw Control. MR variant with upgraded turbocharger and intercooler producing 300 hp. Requires premium fuel and frequent maintenance. Timing belt critical. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mitsubishi Lancer Evolution article, January 17, 2025 revision.

Ninth generation midsize sedan. Timing chain on V6, timing belt on 4-cylinder until 2009 refresh. Discontinued after 2012 model year. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mitsubishi Galant article, January 17, 2025 revision.
Eighth generation midsize sedan. Timing belt maintenance required on both engines. Manual transmission rare. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mitsubishi Galant article, January 17, 2025 revision.

Third generation sport coupe built at Normal, Illinois plant. No longer AWD/turbo variants. Timing belt maintenance required on both engines. Spyder convertible available. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mitsubishi Eclipse article, January 17, 2025 revision.

Fourth and final generation. Larger, heavier design. V6 with 5-speed automatic. Timing chain on both engines. Discontinued after 2012. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mitsubishi Eclipse article, January 17, 2025 revision.

Third generation full-size SUV (Pajero internationally). Super Select 4WD II system with Active Traction Control. Timing belt maintenance required. Discontinued in North America after 2006. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mitsubishi Pajero article, January 17, 2025 revision.

Second generation midsize SUV. Timing belt maintenance required. Discontinued in North America after 2006 model year. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mitsubishi Challenger article, January 17, 2025 revision.

Midsize crossover SUV positioned above Outlander. Timing belt maintenance required. Discontinued after 2011 model year. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mitsubishi Endeavor article, January 17, 2025 revision.

Rebadged Dodge Dakota built at Warren, Michigan plant. Shared powertrains and platform with Dakota. Timing chain engines. Short production run, discontinued after 2009. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mitsubishi Raider article, January 17, 2025 revision.
Third generation full-size luxury sedan. Timing belt maintenance required. Discontinued after 2004 model year. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mitsubishi Diamante article, January 17, 2025 revision.
